app.exercise.algebra

Class Rational

  • java.lang.Object
    • app.exercise.algebra.Rational
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Arithmetic
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CompRational

    public class Rational
extends java.lang.Object
implements Arithmetic
    Rational class that can be used to do arithmetic operations on rational numbers. The denominator of Rational objects is always positive.
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Alexander WÃ¤hling

        private int num
        stores the numerator of the rational number.

      • denom

        private int denom
        stores the denominator of the rational number. Is guaranteed to be always positive.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Rational

        public Rational(int num,
                int denom)
        Initializes a new Rational object with the passed values for the numerator and denominator. Cancels out numerator and denominator.
        Parameters:
        num - numerator of the new Rational object
        denom - denominator of the new Rational object
        See Also:
        num, denom

      • Rational

        public Rational(Rational r)
        Clone constructor. Returns a new Rational object that is identical to the passed one.
        Parameters:
        r - Rational object to clone.

    • Method Detail

      • cancel

        private void cancel()
        Cancels out the numerator and denominator of this object by dividing with their gcd(int, int). Also ensures that the denominator is always positive.

      • getNum

        public int getNum()
        Use to get the numerator of this object.
        Returns:

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Checks if the passed Object is equal to the current Rational object. Returns true if the passed Object is of type Rational and the numerator and denominator from both Rational objects are equal. Otherwise returns false. Implementations guarantees that the equals() method is reflexive, symmetric, transitive and consistent.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - Object to compare to.
        Returns:
        boolean - true if the Objects are equal, otherwise false

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Uses very sophisticated methods to compute a hash value for the current Rational object. Curiously always returns 42.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        Answer to the Ultimate Question of Life, the Universe, and Everything.
